moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4 3. Nf3 Ne7: King's Gambit\Accepted\Bonsch-Osmolovsky Variation -a rather rare variation. Frankly speaking I have played it for the first time
moves.4. Bc4 Ng6: definitely it was better to d5, than to protect a gambit
moves.5. O-O Be7 6. d4 c6 7. Bxf4: After passive moves by my opponent I have notice an opportunity of making pressure on f7 square, so I decided on making a bishop sack
moves.7... Nxf4 8. Ne5 d5: nice try to get the tempo back
moves.9. Rxf4 f6: 2 lesser figures are hanging yet I have a tempo and a nice edgy way to use it
moves.10. Qh5+ g6 11. Nxg6 Kd7 12. Nxh8 Qxh8 1: few last moves weren't the sharpest ones yet they played their role
moves.17... Nd7 18. Nc3 Rb8 19. Qa5+ Ke8 20. R: at this point opponent resign. Possible continuation after Qg7 Rg4. Qf8 Rg8 or something like this
